definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now

sentences.english: John did quite well considering how little he studied.
sentences.chinese: 考慮到約翰才學了那麼一點點，他考得已算很不錯了。

sentences.english: Li Baiyao, the well-known courtier at the early stage of Tang Dynasty, was famous for his talents and virtue.
sentences.chinese: 李百藥是唐初名巨，以才學和操行聞名於世。

sentences.english: The talents studies is a discipline studying talents' growth and development.
sentences.chinese: 人才學是研究人才成長和發展規律的學科。

sentences.english: Let thy Child's first lesson be Obedience, and the second may be what thou wilt.
sentences.chinese: 讓你小孩先學會服從，其次才學你要他學的東西。

sentences.english: John did quite well in his exams considering how little he studied.
sentences.chinese: 考慮到約翰才學了那麼一點點，他考得已很不錯了。

sentences.english: Her beauty and acquirements had held but a second place.
sentences.chinese: 她的美貌和才學只居第二位。

sentences.english: Good man transform to bad man, because been hurt.
sentences.chinese: 好男人全是在被女人傷過後，才學得變壞。

sentences.english: He's read volumes and is an outstanding scholar.
We have studied English for only a year , yet we can act English plays already.
sentences.chinese: 我們才學了一年英語，但已經能演英文劇了。

definition: to learn/to acquire (some skill through practice)/acquisition
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
to surpass others/outstanding/(basketball, soccer etc) to get past an opponent
